TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

By a decision of CARDINAL DATE the Lääne - Viru County Court ( ORG ) discontinued criminal proceedings in respect of the applicant who had been charged with having committed an aggravated fraud involving substantial material damage ( LAW ( DATE ) of LAW ( PERSON ) ) . The decision was taken at the request of the prosecutor , under LAW ORG koodeks ) , according to which criminal proceedings could be discontinued if the punishment liable to be imposed on the accused would be negligible compared to the punishment which would be likely to be imposed on him or her for the commission of another criminal offence . ORG made reference to other proceedings pending before ORG ( PERSON ) which are summarised below .

By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE the ORG convicted ORG and ORG of illicit trafficking of gasoline by a group of persons ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ) . The applicant was convicted of aiding and abetting the above offence ( LAW ( CARDINAL ) and LAW ) . He was sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment , less the time spent in pre - trial detention . PERSON was convicted of misuse of his official position ( LAW ) . The court granted the civil claim of ORG against the applicant , ORG and PERSON in the amount of CARDINAL kroons ( EEK ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) . Finally , it decided to confiscate the property ( gasoline ) that had been seized from the applicant , PERSON and ORG in order to meet the civil claim .
On DATE ORG ( Tallinna GPE ) upheld ORG judgment in substance insofar as it concerned the applicant .
ORG ( NORP ) refused the applicant leave to appeal on DATE .

On DATE the applicant requested ORG to postpone the enforcement of his prison sentence for DATE , as he was critically ill with rheumatoid arthritis and in case his medical treatment were to be discontinued , the inflammation of joints would become more acute . The applicant submitted that he was the sole supporter of his sick parents and that he provided subsistence to a DATE child . On DATE ORG postponed the enforcement of the applicant ’s imprisonment for DATE .

On DATE the applicant requested ORG to lift his sentence due to his incurable illness . By a decision of DATE ORG dismissed his request . It found , on the basis of medical certificates submitted by the applicant , that he had been prescribed pills which could also be taken in prison . It considered that the necessary medical examinations ( once DATE ) could be arranged by the prison authorities in cooperation with a hospital . Therefore , ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request and noted that according to ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE the applicant had to appear in FAC on DATE at the latest to start serving his sentence ( DATE , DATE ) .
The applicant did not appeal against the decision .
